results.title: Devrim
results.creator_credit: Amelia Flores, Mandy King, Zynet Kesting and Migrant Women's Film Group
results.brief_description: Looks at the situation of a young Turkish woman who finds herself in an impossible marriage. Explores her dilemmas, her conditioning both as a migrant and as a woman, and shows how she eventually deals with these. The program is told from a migrant’s perspective, having been written, produced and directed by a group of six migrant women from different countries and backgrounds. Raises issues about migrant women’s lives in Australia, particularly domestic violence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amelia Flores, Mandy King, Zynet Kesting and Migrant Women’s Film Group

results.title: The Golden Dark Age of Reason
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: An exploration of the beauty of New York’s classically inspired architecture; the Chrysler Building, a blimp passing over the Brooklyn Bridge, a young boy performing backflips on a street corner.
results.description: An exploration of the beauty of New York’s classically inspired architecture; the Chrysler Building, a blimp passing over the Brooklyn Bridge, a young boy performing backflips on a street corner.

results.title: If Every Girl Had a Diary
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: Sadie Benning’s video diaries form a unique record of the development of a young artist. Within the confines of her bedroom, she creates a dense experimental work about a teenagers search for sexual and non-conformist expression. ‘If Every Girl Had a Diary’ is an intimate insight into suburban malaise and alienation, as well as being a defiantly accomplished piece of video art.

results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.
results.title_for_label: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.

results.title: Fire of the Land
results.creator_credit: Valerie Bichard, Eliza Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
results.description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.

results.title: Bad Habits
results.creator_credit: Jason Ramp, Justin Davies, AFTRS and Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent
results.brief_description: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).
